Domine: quoniam sanctus sum; salvum fac servum tuum
et exaudī mē: spērantem in tē. ^ Preserve my soul
quoniam inops et pauper sum egō. ^ Incl: for I am holy; save thy servant

aurem tuam: quoniam ad tē clāmāvī tōtā diē. ^ Have mercy on me
quoniam inops et pauper sum egō. ^ Incl: for I have cried to thee all the day.

et exaudī mē: animam meam levāvī. ^ Give joy to the soul of thy servant
and hear me: I have lifted up my soul.

et exaudī mē: et multae misericordiae omnibus invocantibus tē. ^ For thou
and hear me: and plenteous in mercy to all that call upon thee.

et exaudī mē: et intende vōcī dēprecātiōnis meae. ^ Give ear
and hear me: and attend to the voice of my petition.

1 ^ Inclīnā: 7 ^ In diē trībulātiōnis meae clāmāvī ad tē
Domine: quia exaudīvistī mē. ^ I have called upon thee in the day of my trouble

1 ^ Inclīnā: 8 ^ Nōn est similis tuī in deīs
aurem tuam: et nōn est secundum opera tua. ^ There is none among the gods like unto thee
quoniam inops et pauper sum egō. ^ Incl: and there is none according to thy works.

et exaudī mē: et glōrificābunt nōmen tuum. ^ All the nations thou hast made shall come and adore before thee
O Lord: and they shall glorify thy name.

Domine: et faciens mīrābilia; tū es Deus sōlus. ^ For thou art great and dost wonderful things; thou art God alone.

et exaudī mē: et ingrediar in vēritāte tuā; laetētur cor meum ut timeat nōmen tuum. ^ Conduct me
and hear me: and I will walk in thy truth; let my heart rejoice that it may fear thy name.

et exaudī mē: et glōrificābō nōmen tuum in aeternum; ^ I will praise thee
and hear me: and I will glorify thy name for ever;

1 ^ Inclīnā: 13 ^ quia misericordia tua magna est super mē
Domine: et ēruistī animam meam ex infernō inferiōrī. ^ for thy mercy is great towards me
aurem tuam: and thou hast delivered my soul out of the lower hell.
et sinagōga potentium quaesīvērunt animam meam
et exaudī mē: et nōn prōposuērunt tē in conspectū suō. ^ O God
quoniam inops et pauper sum egō. ^ Incl: the wicked are risen up against me
O Lord: and the assembly of the mighty have sought my soul
and hear me: and they have not set thee before their eyes.

Domine: et miserēre meī; dā imperium tuum puerō tuō
aurem tuam: et salvum fac fīlium ancillae tuae. ^ O look upon me
et exaudī mē: and have mercy on me; give thy command to thy servant
quoniam inops et pauper sum egō. ^ Incl: and save the son of thy handmaid.

O Lord: et consōlātus es mē. ^ Show unto me a token for good
and hear me: that they who hate me may see
column10: hast helped me and hast comforted me.
